senses.de: To have or find room for someone or something
senses.ex: The conference room can accommodate up to 50 people

Tips.title: Capacity Limit
Tips.description: Use 'accommodate' to express the maximum number of people or items a space can take.

Tips.title: Event Planning
Tips.description: 'Accommodate' is often used when organizing events to ensure enough space for attendees.
Tips.example: The wedding venue needs to accommodate all our guests comfortably.

senses.de: To change something to suit someone's wishes or needs
senses.ex: We will accommodate your dietary preferences in our menu

Tips.title: Flexibility
Tips.description: Shows willingness to change or help suit someone else's needs or preferences.
Tips.example: The teacher will accommodate the lessons for different learning styles.

Tips.title: Customer Service
Tips.description: In customer service, 'accommodate' implies meeting clients' special requests.
Tips.example: We strive to accommodate our clients' specific needs.

senses.de: To provide someone with a place to live or to be stored in
senses.ex: Most hotels can accommodate guests with disabilities

Tips.title: Housing
Tips.description: Use 'accommodate' to talk about providing a place for people to live or stay.

Tips.title: Storage
Tips.description: Also refers to having enough space to store things.
Tips.example: The warehouse can accommodate large quantities of goods.

senses.de: To do a favor or kindness for someone
senses.ex: She was kind enough to accommodate my request for a detailed report

Tips.title: Act of Kindness
Tips.description: Means to go out of your way to help or satisfy someone's request.
Tips.example: The librarian accommodated my need for extra research material.

Tips.title: Beyond Obligation
Tips.description: Suggests doing something helpful that you are not required to do.
Tips.example: He accommodated our late arrival, though it was after check-in time.

senses.ex: The living room can comfortably accommodate a large sofa set

Tips.title: Spatial Arrangement
Tips.description: Relates to organizing a space to fit everything or everyone adequately.
Tips.example: We rearranged the room to accommodate more desks.

Tips.title: Comfort Consideration
Tips.description: When accommodating, consider people's comfort, not just fitting them in a space.
Tips.example: The hall was arranged to accommodate guests with enough legroom.

Board.wordDefinition:
Board means to provide food and lodging, typically in exchange for payment. For example, a person can board at a bed and breakfast or at a university dorm.

Accommodate refers to providing a space or place while board refers to providing a space, food, and lodging in return for payment.

Entertain.wordDefinition:
Entertain means to provide amusement, enjoyment or pleasure to someone. For example, a host may entertain their guests with games, music, or conversation during a party.

Entertaining usually involves engaging someone in enjoyable activities rather than just providing a physical space or service.

Accommodate means providing a space or service, while entertain means providing enjoyment or amusement.

Host.wordDefinition:
Host means to entertain or provide a gathering place for someone or something. It is applicable when you are inviting someone or a group of people to a party or gathering.

For example, "I am hosting a barbecue party this weekend."

House.wordDefinition:
House specifically relates to providing shelter or a place to live, sleep, or work. It may include providing furniture and other essential items, and typically implies more long-term residency than accommodate would.

House is most commonly used when referring to a specific location where people or things are staying or residing, such as a family living in a house or an organization housing its employees.

Lodge.wordDefinition:
Accommodate means to provide lodging or room for someone. It is commonly used when talking about providing a place for someone to stay, either temporarily or permanently.

Lodge means to stay or reside in a particular place or to provide someone with a place to stay temporarily.

Accommodate refers to the act of providing lodging, while lodge refers to the act of staying in a specific place.

Quarter.wordDefinition:
Quarter can refer to a specific portion of something or an area designated for a particular purpose.

Accommodate describes a temporary place to stay, while quarter describes a more permanent living arrangement or designated area.

Receive.wordDefinition:
Receive means to accept or welcome someone or something, like receiving a package or receiving guests at your home.

However, receive can also mean accommodating in certain contexts, like when a hotel can receive or accept bookings.

Accommodate is more focused on providing space while receive is more focused on accepting or welcoming someone or something.

Shelter.wordDefinition:
Shelter means to provide protection or a safe place from danger, particularly from the elements. It is applicable when talking about protecting individuals or animals from harm, such as sheltering from a storm or providing a haven for homeless people.

For example, a homeless shelter provides a safe place for those who have nowhere else to go.

quotes.Text: Most of the people I know who were raised to be accommodating or were raised to just be nice and put everybody's needs ahead of theirs, there comes a moment when the pressure builds and they can't do it anymore. They have needs and they feel neglected and they usually explode.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Stephen Chbosky

quotes.Text: I realized I was trained my whole life to be an accommodating person, to make sure that everybody is comfortable before I'm comfortable. After giving so much of myself to strangers, I learned to care for myself a little more, especially on tour.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Frankie Cosmos

quotes.Text: The hardest thing is spending twelve hours a day accommodating the rest of the world, then going home at night and criticizing it. I would be curious about what I'd write if I didn't have to worry about offending.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Sloane Crosley

quotes.Text: My background has been very helpful for this experience. But everyone was so accommodating because they knew it's not the most comfortable position to be the new kid.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jeri Ryan

quotes.Text: My mother told me you marry whoever you want to, as long as you are happy. My parents are very accommodating, and I know they will always support me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Sangram Singh

quotes.Text: Jazz can accommodate so many things. Jazz is like the universe: it's been expanding since its creation, and it's connected to everything.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jon Batiste

quotes.Text: In every film, I sport a different look for each character. It's almost as if my features change to accommodate the characters.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Padmapriya Janakiraman

quotes.Text: Nothing remains great without a capacity to change and to accommodate the conditions of a changing world.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: John Ashcroft

quotes.Text: I can't really change my life to accommodate people who are jealous. I don't see why I should.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: Sting

quotes.Text: I believe in lifestyle changes to accommodate a healthy living.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Hilary Knight
